newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada to auction C$400 mln real return bonds.
newsitem.headline: Canada to auction C$400 mln real return bonds.

text.p: The Government of Canada said it plans to auction on August 28 a total of C$400 million of 4.25 percent real return bonds maturing on December 1, 2026.
The bonds, which will be dated and delivered on September 6, pay interest on December 1 and June 1. They are in addition to C$1.05 billion 4.25 percent bonds due 2026 outstanding.

They will be issued with accrued inflation compensation from December 7, 1995 and accrued coupon interest from June 1, 1996. The reference consumer price index base is 133.88065, and the index ratio on September 6 will be 1.01284. Proceeds will be used for general government purposes.
